caption.title: Spatial distribution of effective and non-effective protected areas (PAs) in the Brazilian Amazon.
caption.p: Effective PAs are those supposed to buffer species against effects of climate change as assessed by a null model that allocated each PA within the Amazon keeping its size, shape and orientation. These results are based on a combination of four climatic variables and a high-emission greenhouse gases scenario (RCP8.5) for 2070. See text for further details. All shapefiles are from the Brazilian Ministry of the Environment.
Click here for additional data file.
